Texts.Chs: ...一旦剂量足够，你就会觉得自己的思想真正地打开了。 就像你有点...男孩子气，这很难形容...就像你进入另一个维度。 你看到分形，看到各种隧道。 它们在你的视野中旋转，扭曲你所看到的一切。 然后，当你穿过这条隧道时...你最终会到达终点并突破！ 然后...哇。
Texts.Eng: ...and once the dose is sufficient, you'll feel your mind truly open up. It's as if you sort of...boy,is this hard to describe...like you enter another dimension. You see fractals, a tunnel of sorts. It swirls in your vision, warping all you see. And then, as you travel through this tunnel...you'll eventually reach the end and break through! And then....wow.

Texts.Chs: 一本描述某种物质影响的书。
Texts.Eng: A book describing the effects of some sort of substance...

Texts.Chs: 突破宛如新生。就像有人揭开了现实的面纱，向你展示真实的世界。一切都变了。我的意思是——所有的东西——。你变得过度敏锐，以前从未有过的体验对你来说是显而易见的(甚至在效力消失之后你仍然可以看到很多！)，并且最后你能知晓真相。
Texts.Eng: Breaking through is like rebirth. Like someone lifted the veil of reality, and showed you the real world underneath. Everything changes. And I do mean -everything-. You become hyper-aware, and things that were never there before become obvious to you (things you still see even after the effects wear off!) and at long last you know the truth.

Texts.Chs: 想象一下，从一个兔子洞掉下来，进入一个充满色彩和声响的全新世界，让你感觉以前的所有经历都不对...堕落。死亡。这只是粗略的近似，真的...它甚至比这更强大。
Texts.Eng: Imagine falling down a rabbit hole and entering an entirely new world full of color and sound and feeling that makes all of your previous experience feel wrong...inferior. Dead. That's a rough approximation of it, really...it's far more powerful than even that.

Texts.Chs: 我们所处的现实，我们所知道并非理所当然...一切皆是谎言。声音更真实，事物更美丽(或可怕)，每一种感觉都被带到了新的极端。在这个地方...这个新的空间...维度，无论如何...有些人正与你沟通。他们似乎是仁慈的，好像有一些重要的事要告诉你。
Texts.Eng: That our reality, the one we know and take for granted...is a lie. Sound is more real, things are more beautiful (or terrifying) and every sensation is taken to new extremes. In this place...this new space...dimension, whatever...there are beings communicating with you. They seem benevolent, and as if they have something important to tell you.

Texts.Chs: 他们讲的内容是不可能理解的，但他们似乎完全无害（只是大多数情况下。我听说过那些心灵不太稳定的人会听到更黑暗的故事）。 对于大多数人来说，这好像是在遇见天体，遇见全能的仆人。 但无论你怎么努力，你都无法理解它们。
Texts.Eng: The speech is impossible to understand, but there seems to be nothing harmful about them (for the most part anyhow. I've heard tales that things can be much darker for those with less stable psyches). For most, its as if you are meeting celestial beings, servants to the Allmighty. But no matter what you do, you'll not be able to understand them.

Texts.Chs: 如果你只是看，他们只会向你展示生活的真实面貌。不要搞错，但是...肯定不是上帝。完全是另一回事。奇怪的东西，更奇怪的东西。绿色的绿松石液体流过你，从内部改变你。永远。效果消失后进行的测试显示物种层面的遗传信息
Texts.Eng: They are just showing you what life can truly be, if you only look. Make no mistake, however...it is most certainly not God. It is something else entirely. Something stranger and ever more bizarre. The greenish-turqoise fluid flows through you, changing you from the inside. Forever. Tests made after the effects wear off show alteration at the genetic

Texts.Chs: 这玩意由无法识别的元素组成。它究竟是从哪里来的？如果您选择摄取这种奇怪的液体...请小心。所有这些听起来都很吸引人，我敢肯定...但是一旦效果消失，你将永远不复从前。你甚至可能会开始听到...
Texts.Eng: composed of elements that remain impossible to identify. From whence did it come? If you opt to ingest this strange liquid...take care. All of this sounds fascinating, I am sure...but once the effects wear off you will forever cease to be who you were before. And you might even start to hear the Call....

Texts.Chs: 发生了改变。这物质本源是合成的，经由活人之手设计，但其来源仍然未知。它似乎只是出现在宇宙周围而没有规律或理由(而且我听说过以正确的方式混合特定液体甚至可以创造它...不知何故)。其中四分之三的内容仍然不为科学所知，
Texts.Eng: level for most species. The substance itself is synthetic, engineered by living hands, but its origin remains unknown. It simply seems to occur in places around the cosmos without rhyme or reason (and I have heard tales that mixing particular liquids in the right way can even create it...somehow). Three-quarters of its contents remain unknown to science,
